title.narrative: Africa Programme for Peace, Phase IV

description.narrative: The APP is aimed at strengthening the African Union (AU) and selected Regional Economic Communities (RECs) within the area of peace, security and democratic governance.

participating-org.narrative: Economic Community of West African States

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Denmark has contributed to ECOWAS’ strategic objective: ECOWAS ensures peace, security and good governance in the West African Region

1. ECOWAS has used preventive diplomacy and mediation to solve crisis in and among member states (MSs) 2. ECOWAS has monitored elections in MSs and contributes to strengthen Electoral Monitoring Bodies (EMBs)

target.value: 1.ECOWAS intervened with preventive diplomacy and/or mediation in all crises in the region. which threaten national or regional cohesion. 2. All elections in Member States are monitored by ECOWAS in cooperation with AU in 2021.

title.narrative: ECOWAS has observed elections in MSs and strengthened EMBs

1. # of elections observed by short term observation missions (STOMs) and long term observation missions (LTOMs) respectively 2. # of EMBs strengthened through peer-support 3. # of political parties and media practitioners trained.

target.value: 1. Three Presidential and General elections observed; 2. Political parties / Media trained on elections and political rights in 3 MS.

actual.value: Due to COVID and travel restrictions, the planned election observation mission were not conducted. However, DK funded 7 days extension of election observation of 8 persons in Nigeria LTO workshop training held for 30 participants

target.value: 1. Three Presidential and General elections observed; 2. Political parties / Media trained on elections and political rights in 3 MS.
1. Two Presidential elections observed (Sierra Leone and Mali) by LTOMs; 2. Political parties / Media trained on elections and political rights in 2 MS.

actual.value: No implementation due to late submission of audits which affected the disbursement schedule

title.narrative: Increased coordination, monitoring, awareness promotion and synergy towards the implementation of the ECPF at three levels; ECOWAS Directorates, Member States and CSOs

1. Three-year strategic Plans of Action for the ECPF are developed, adopted and implemented. 2 The ECPF-secretariat ensures that annual work plans for ECOWAS’ Focal Point Directorates, Member States and CSOs are developed and approved and the Internal Steering Committee (ISC) meet hi-annually.

actual.value: ECPF Plans of Action 2018 – 2020 implemented in 2019
No implementation of funds due to late submission of audit
review and assessment not done in 2020 due to COVID but has been done in July 2021 ISC meets bi-annually ECPF focal point meetings held. Workshops w. Private sector. Conference with CSOs held

title.narrative: Preventive Diplomacy is applied in the management, resolution and peacebuilding phases of conflicts through Mediation Facilitation and International Cooperation

1. The capacity of mediators and facilitators, the Council of the Wise, Special Representatives and other regional mediation institutions is strengthened and backstopped by ECOWAS.
2. Enhanced coordination, cooperation and synergy of ECOWAS efforts within the overall AU and UN security architecture with a view to resolving identified challenges facing the region.

actual.value: Capacity enhancement workshop conducted Decade of operationalisation of ECOWAS in conflict prevention conference was held Annual impact analysis was not conducted PAPS Quarterly Briefing with Ambassadors on Peace and Security
no implementation due to the late submission of audit reports
